review_title: SRK's track with old flame Kajol keeps coming and going

review_detailed_main:
The film is mediocre from the word GO. Varun Dhawan's sounds like he never grew up after the age 12 or may be was force fed with his dad's Govinda films, day and night with eye lids stapled to keep it from blinking, a la clockwork orange. He has tranformed into Govinda cube (I barely managed Govinda let alone cube). Kirti Sanon is another piece of trash, but I let her pass since she is a hottie, at least they offer something. SRK does shine in few moments with Kajol but he seems under pressure to deliver the so much talked about chemistry and hence uses all his moves whether its his curved eye brows or the arched smile. He has been glorified like a South Indian superstar with physics defying stunts wearing the look that only only impresses a straight collared rickshaw driver who would wear an aviator while driving , with Sanjay Dutt's painted posters as his mud guard graffiti. The film shifts gears from an action to romance stupidly, you don't realize when they are in love and when they want to fight. Some of SRK's emotionally romantic dialogues are so funnily delivered, you don't understand whether you're supposed to laugh or feel sorry for the situation. Kajol is slightly better compared to the rest.

The jokes are pure slapstick, Johnny Lever using the recycled formula of oscillating his eye brows up and down, Sanjay Mishra mouthing off one liners that makes you think whether it was targeted to the kindergarten audience, and Boman Irani playing the laughing stock one more time.

Cinematography is the usual hyper saturated bright colours with terribly LOW apertures that Rohit uses in all of his films. The production design is pathetically fake, unsurprisingly, in fact a set in a theater drama seems more deceiving than a Shetty film. He definitely needs to fire the guy he's been using for design or downsize his own brain. The films offers slightly more layers than his past films in terms of stories though, which still doesn't save the film from sliding down the manhole. The three stars is only for the slightly improved layers and SRK's final dialogue to Kajol, which will definitely bring a smile on your face.

review_title: Dilwale is a perfect combination of romance, comedy, action, drama. & entertainment.
review_detailed_main:
After the super success of their last collaboration Chennai Express, I had too much expectations from Rohit Shetty and Shah Rukh Khan. While Chennai Express was only about comedy, action & bit romance. Dilwale looks a lot more appealing than Chennai Exp & has much more to offer than what CE had.

The film looks interesting right from the start. 1st half starts from the flashback with typical Bollywood style, Family problems in between two lovers. SRK is charismatic as always & Kajol looks amazingly gorgeous even after so many years. Film continues with proper mixing of comedy, romance, drama & action. Film's action is quite world class, way ahead of Bollywood's level. Songs especially Gerua and Janam Janam are magnificently picturised & looks damn amazing on big screen.

2nd part of the movie starts with the cool love story of Varun Dhawan and the very beautiful Kriti Sanon. Their energy level is something to look for & they don't spoil the love essence of SRK-Kajol romance created in the 1st half of the film. Film's huge budget makes it even more watchable. From lavish cars to Bulgaria locations. Everything looks so grand & eye catching.

Talking about the comedy element in the film, Varun Sharma, Boman Irani, Sanjay Mishra and Johnny Lever make you laugh loud. Rohit Shetty has perfectly mixed up their comedy scenes in between to keep the movie going in an entertaining flow.

Overall, Dilwale is a great joyride with plenty to watch out for everyone. Beautiful music. Amazing action. Unbelievable landscapes, Energetic Varun-Kriti. And of course, the evergreen SRK-Kajol. Each of these elements make you keep watching the film. And when put together, Dilwale is the great entertaining result. From romance to comedy to action to drama, Dilwale has got EVERYTHING. A perfect entertainer for your Christmas :)

review_title: Over Colored Rohit Shetty movie. Nothing good except the magic of SRK and Kajol
review_detailed_main: Dilwale - what I understood, what I got as takeaway facts or what I wanted to share about the movie: (press see more to read all points) Watched Dilwale with my dearies Gajin Shrestha Bunz Grg Zyola Dlama 1. Story is definitely minimum 30 years old. 2. Though the story was pretty old the romance seems to have become younger. What a chemistry or whatever they say between the leads (SRK and Kajol) they were as fresh as a daisy. No wonder they are called the best on screen pair of Bollywood sorry I could say they are the best pair of all woods. 3. Kajol is not dusky anymore is that bothering me? No this 41 years old lass was in her great shapes and looked better than the 25 years old Kirti Sanon. She owes a great deal to the makeup artist, camera man or the post production team whoever is the reason for this. 4. SRK man how come he has the attraction in him still I wonder. 5. Rohit Shetty one obligation to you please reduce the over color effect on screen and depend on the natural colors. I am afraid I will have color blindness because of you. 6. Poor Varun and Kirti they were there as prey to show us that even with these younger bloods on screen still SRK and Kajol rocked. 7. Gerua is one mesmerizing song that deserve repetition in our phones Overall chop all crap scenes and watch the scenes of the romantic fantasy scenes between SRK and Kajol they still have the magic in them.

review_title: SRK + Kajol treat, other characters were not as good.
review_detailed_main:
SRK and Kajol are an absolute treat in this film. The mafia-level love story in the flashbacks and on present time are wonderful to watch; the two veteran actors have proved through this film that even after 20 years of being Bollywood's favorite jodi, they can still deliver. I loved watching SRK and Kajol. Their gazes are intense, their expressions genuine and their tears pull on the heartstrings. They operate and act on another whole level compared to the rest. Unfortunately, the sideline characters / actors are atrocious and bring this movie down many levels. Their comedic lines do not deliver. They overact to the point it becomes cringey, and it feels all too superficial.

SRK does a particularly good job in the action scenes. Kajol's icy stare can give you chills. Rohit Shetty's car scenes and beautiful shots in Goa and the background are mesmerizing.

The particularly bad thing about this film is the lack of a concrete conflict, especially in the second half. It feels scattered and aimless when it should be building up to the main clash.

There's bad writing and dialogue on this one, which is a far shame for such a strong ensemble cast. After all, with great power comes great responsibility. Because of their super stardom (particularly SRK) and numerous awards, expectations are high and they have the skill and charisma to meet it. They are timeless. This movie is not. SRK and Kajol deserved better.

Lower your expectations though and you'll get such fun family entertainment for all!

The Gerua song got me into the theatre. But much to my chagrin, it so happens, that that was the only watchable part of this entire atrocity. Why does Shah Rukh make movies like this?? It can't be for the money. It is ridiculously cheesy. A pain. A real pain. I would go as far as to say that it is an atrocity. The treatment of the story is childish. Scene after scene leaves one cold. This was the first movie in ages that i felt called for a refund, and i watch pretty much any movie that plays in the local movie hall. It is a parade of childish antics and inane dialogues, with meaningless and dull action scenes strung together. What an absolute waste of time.

Kajol and Sharukh together in a movie always raises expectations, because this is one pair who we know will not disappoint their audience, no matter how bad the script or film is. Well Rohit Shetty ventures to prove this very thing with DILWALE, a crappy script, a stinking screenplay , and two stars desperately trying to save the movie from falling apart, and yes he does succeed to an extent.

The movie is ridden with all the clichés that you have been seeing right from the '70s and you lay back on the comfortable (not so comfortable now) seats and ask the one question which keeping popping in your head Why Sharukh why? Why Kajol why?

Getting into the story, it is about Raj Randhir Bakshi (Sharukh Khan) who owns a garage in Goa and who dotes on his younger brother Veer (Varun Dhawan). Veer falls in love with Ishita (Kriti Sanon) and Raj decides to meet Ishita's elder sister to get the wedding going. Turns out the lady in question is Meera Dev Malik (Kajol) who says no to the wedding as she and Raj where lovers in the past and belonged to rival gang families and she believes that Kali (Sharukh Khan), as Raj was called then was behind her Father's (Kabir Bedi)'s death.

The young lovers now decide to get the elderly lovers together so that their marriage can go ahead without any problem. Kajol is excellent as Meera, and she excels more as the bad girl then as the love lorn spinster. She gives a wow performance in the scene where she reveals her true identity, would have been a lot more interesting if Rohit Shetty had worked on the Bad girl angle.

Sharukh is well Sharukh all the way, trying to raise above a mundane script, but gives his 100% to the role, the scene where he goes on the 5 minute date has flashes of the old Sharukh we knew and loved.

Varun Dhawan looks as if he is trying to fit into the vacant slot left by Govinda, he is loud, and hams through the movie.

Kriti Sanon tries to act, and joins Rohit Shetty in a losing battle.

The other saving grace is Johnny Lever, with his weird South Indian Accent, manages to get you laughing every time he appears on the screen.

Vinod Khanna and Kabir Bedi are just glorified extras. By the time you realize whether Boman Irani is a comedian, or a Villain, you are on your way home

Cinematography by Dudley is excellent especially for the song "Gerua" and the Bulgaria Episode.

Pritam's music is OK, not a chart buster which you would expect from a Kajol-Sharukh starer.

Screenplay and Direction by Rohit Shetty is nothing but like a child's scrap book where he has collected scenes from all the movies produced from the late 70's till date and glued them together.

Watch it for Sharukh and Kajol-at least the pair is worth the ticket.

Story is so stupid and makes us chuckle at times. The Ram Lal Dhobi twist is so disgusting and annoying. SUDDEN down pour of HEAVY, artificial rain in one scene makes us chuckle saying, "Holy crap" to ourselves. Flashbacks are done by a seemingly inexperienced director.

Music is dumb and loud. We forget it the moment we walk out of the theater.

There is no chemistry or character-building and when actors weep, it does not have any effect on us and it is even ANNOYING.

Its a shame our standards have fallen to this low level. Avoid this one at all costs. Go watch Star Wars instead and you will be glad you skipped it.

review_title: One of the finest Bollywood movies I have watched in recent times.
review_detailed_main: Dilwale contains all the elements that a film needs in order to get declared as a Blockbuster. It has perfect comedy scenes, breath-taking action scenes and way too awesome romantic scenes. You'll just love the SRK-Kajol pairing. The songs are beautiful to watch and are perfectly placed in the movie. Sanjay Mishra,Johnny Lever and Varun Dhawan were too good in the movie. There are also some twists in the movie. I had gone with less expectations for the movie as I was aware of the type of movies made by Rohit Shetty. But I was totally shocked and surprised to see that Dilwale was a completely different movie. It's not at all a typical Rohit Shetty movie. You never want the movie to end and the length of just 2 and a half hours seemed too less. I've read some reviews here and I am really upset to see people giving bad reviews here. I believe that they are the one who haven't watched the movie yet and have just read some false stories of it somewhere. People, please do not believe on those reviews. Go for the movie. You'll fall in love with Indian cinema again.
I don't find any story in it ..just carried by overacting without any message.

Not expected that much of trash.

Really disappointed to see srk not even trying to act.

review_title: A Horribly Wasted Kajol-Shah Rukh Jodi
review_detailed_main:
I love to see Kajol and King Khan together, I mean who doesn't? But this movie was so boring, so stupid and pointless with forgettable uninteresting songs that even watching these two together on the screen couldn't stop me from fast-forwarding. I think the only, and only reason for them to have accepted to star in this horrible movie was kind of like that of Bill Murray's signing the Garfield movie thinking "Joel Coen" (one of the Coen brothers) has written it, later finding out it was written by a "Joel Cohen" with a big H for Horrible!! Shah and Kajol too signed the contract without reading the script based on Rohit Shetty's name and when they found out what a swamp they've gotten themselves into they contractually couldn't get out.

Looking at Aamir's movies in recent years such as PK and Dangal and Shah's Dilwale, I must say I am so disappointed in my favorite Khan.

The 3 stars are only for the song they had together which I can't even remember what it was about, but they were beautiful and the cinematography of that song was mesmerizing.

Dilwale (translation: The Big Hearted) is a 2015 Indian romantic action comedy film directed by Rohit Shetty, and produced by Gauri Khan and Rohit Shetty under the banner of Red Chillies Entertainment and Rohit Shetty Productions respectively. The film is very good in the overall story and non woven deviation and beautiful music in a wonderful film but did not succeed in giving a sense of the comic in terms of comedy But the film will never tire to watch and The story will attract you from the first The story will attract you from the first It could have been presented better On the whole I think that the film could have become a wonderful film, the spectrum to improve some of the dialogues and comedy that was superficial .

review_title: overrated movie nothing special in this to pay for
review_detailed_main:
I usually like Rohit Shetty films but this one is really boring.There is nothing special in this movie except songs to pay for.This film has only got its status due to its huge star cast. Dilwale has earned approx 145 crores just because of SRK and Kajol as they are reuniting after several years. Kriti Snaon has played her role well much there are comedy scene in the movie but not up to the mark Jhonny lever,Sanjay Mishra and Varun Sharma played their comic roles well and so they take all the credit for their scenes Varun Dhawan has done a lot of over acting his comedy scene are not looking like comedy scenes chemistry between srk and kajol is very good that will entertain the audiences

if u take allover dilwale is an over rated movie and not at all good like rohit shetty's other movies

review_title: I loved it!!! I really loved it!!!
review_detailed_main:
I sincerely loved the movie. At first with all the bad reviews, I had to watch how bad it was. SRK & Kajol has always been my best couple to watch. And seeing bad reviews, it broke my heart. I just had to watch it. But watching it, it's not bad at all. There may have been over-acting in some areas (not with Kajol or SRK at all), but come on, many of our favorite movies have areas you want to fast forward when you are re-watching it again!

For me, I loved it! I loved SRK & Kajol in it. I loved to see them in the way the movie portrayed them! It was lovely to watch and I was left laughing with many unforgettable dialogues and scenes!!!!!

this is utter crap. Khans are taking users for granted. you should watch many underrated low budget movies instead of such expensive crap. no sense, crap humour, predictable end, horrible songs, aged hero , same romantic steps make you sick.. only blind shah rukh khan follower may like this film.

at 50, srk should do some character movies like akshay kumaar is doing. he should know that he is no more in his 30's or 40's. note for viewers,

don't watch this movie by reading its commercial collection. do read review and save your money.

Shahrukh tries to pull off a Salman and thinks he can get away without acting for a change. Kajol is too focused on maintaining her balance in high heels so isn't able to pay much attention to acting. Varun dhawan's overacting makes up for the lack on their parts. Johny lever brilliantly competes with the loudness of colors in the scenes. As if the noise wasn't enough, a newbie tries to recreate the magic of the very famous (overrated and ghisa-pita) scene from pyar Ka punchnama. Boman Irani is overpowered (finally!) by all that commotion and is forced to act within normal limits but still fails to control his facial expressions. Kriti Sanon and Sanjay Mishra are the only good things about the movie. Rohit shetty relied heavily on colors and the SRK-Kajol chemistry but both ditched him. If he didn't forget to hire a dialogue writer, the movie would've done sliiiightly better, probably.

I think when Varun Dhawan compared it to inception, what he actually meant was - Dilwale is so boring that you fall asleep during the movie and start having dreams which are nightmares about this movie and to escape that you start dreaming again in your dreams and the chase continues...

review_title: Bad film as a whole....No sense in anything related to the movie.

review_detailed_main: This time around Shah Rukh shares space with Varun Dhawan who, in turn has a romantic track with Kriti Sanon, and a bumbling best friend track with Varun Sharma: SRK's track with old flame Kajol, which is meant to be the film's mainstay, keeps coming and going. And the other bit parts come and go, too, pretty much on a whim. It's almost as if someone says, now let's bung in a comic track, and out tumble Johnny Lever as a car thief, and Sanjay Misra as a pony- tailed receiver of stolen cars, and Boman Irani as a pink-jacketed mobster with a love of vintage cars. Yes, cars do play a big part here, as they do in most Shetty films. And yes, a couple blow up most satisfactorily. But 'Dilwale', on the whole, is a plot less drag : the slaphappy antics you see on screen are a random jumble of light, camera, action, done in the broadest sense. In this rigmarole, SRK is the only thing worth watching when he switches on the wattage ( Kajol can shine, too, when she chooses to), but his twin parts—a 'car modifier' named Raj, and a gangster called Kali (yes, that's right), are both familiar and bland. When old hands SRK and Kajol look into each other's eyes, they can still make you feel it, except it doesn't happen enough. Not by a long shot.

review_title: Dilwale is a paisa vasool entertainer
review_detailed_main: Dilwale is out and out an entertaining and a family film. What's good: Acting, Direction, Excellent music, Cinematography, Humour, Dialogues, Action, Chemistry among actors, Cinematography. What's bad: Editing could be better. Verdict: Dilwale is a package which will attract mass audiences. Class audiences will also like it if they emphasize entertainment over content.

review_title: If SRK and Kajol werent the cast, don't watch it.
review_detailed_main:
If you are fans of SRK and Kajol, and have watched their previous projects for hundred times already, you named it, then you must feel disappointed with this movie. You might wont question their chemistry no more, they always deliver their best. But Dilwale was like a huge hole that you cannot even mend it anymore. Some scenes were super cringe and looks so cheap even for bollywood level. They took some scenes overseas tho but it didnt help much. Their Gerua's clip was exceptionally breathtaking and the only thing I honestly like from the entire movie.

The movie also tried to make some montage scenes which I think it was the way to emphasize the sorrow, how they were both in pain as the result of their forbidden love but it didnt work at all. It was actually confusing.

Look at the movie's premise, I might say that it's interesting enough. However they didnt produce it well enough to gain viewers sympathy. If the main casts werent SRK and Kajol, it will be just another expensive-but-ordinary bollywood movie.

Dilwale is all about entertainment as it promised before release. Just loved every bit of it. SRK-Kajol just unbeatable as always. SRK-Kajol chemistry in a different avatar.I guess they have not done any movie like this before, Kajol is a great actress and her command on delivering dialog is just awesome. Shah Rukh Khan in actions scenes really excels and he is just awesome with Kajol. Varun and Kriti is a fresh new pair. They complement each other really well. Special mention to Varun Sharma, he is really good in comedy, previously I liked him in Fukrey and here he also shines in his own way. The songs in big screen appeared as a treat to eye! The comedy, action, romance and family drama all in one place. In one sentence Dilwale is the full on entertainer in this festive season.

It's sad to see "Dilwale" get so much slack for the overacting and the directing. I honestly didn't LOVE it either but it was alright. Fun little movie with a half-decent premise. It was decent, nothing more, nothing less. Just smack dab in the middle, 5/10 stars.

Listen, it's Bollywood, of course there's going to be overacting and over the top action/fight scenes. Name me one Bollywood movie who doesn't exaggerate like this. So to me, all the people/critics who doesn't like this movie because of a reason like that, I can't respect at all. Like I said, this was neither too bad nor too good. It was just, a good middle if you can put it like that.

It's very surreal to see dons with gold-plated guns dancing in snow- covered desert and chilling waterfalls.And who says only James Wan can direct Furious 7? Our Shetty boy is equally good at drifting. Don't believe me? Watch Varun Dhawan's drift in Dilwale. But here's a friendly advice: Don't dare to catch the director's drift.

Once you're over with "dil ka chilka" kind of songs and "King ka aadmi mujhe drugs bechne ko bolta hai" sort of dialogues, you'll start wondering about the film's huge canvas and its lack of coherence. Pankaj Tripathi and Mukesh Tiwari's comic timing is a good thing about Dilwale. In fact, Tiwari and Tripathi are instrumental in making the audience sit through this 135-minute film.

Dilwale hugely banks upon Khan's stardom and he tries his best to reciprocate. The rest of Dilwale has a very little heart or should i say not heart at all.

well i saw so many paid pr review on this site.well i have suggestion for them that if you are paid pr at least don't give a ten star it looks so obvious that you are paid.because this movie doesn't deserve ten from any angle.

It is really an awesome feeling to watch SRK & Kajol share screen space after so long. Die hard SRK-Kajol fans should not miss this one at all.

Comedy and dialogues of Varun Sharma, Sanjay Mishra & Johnny Lever are fantastic. You will literally enjoy their portion. Varun is also amazing & justifies his character(INCEPTION wala comment hata ke... :D). Kriti looks stunning in each and every scene.

Songs are good. Costumes are fantastic. Screenplay is also decent.

I really liked the bromance between SRK-Varun. Audience will also appreciate their role.

Really fantastic movie if you want to watch it on this weekend. It is a family entertainer so chill out and have fun.

review_title: Dilwale is a sure shot winner
review_detailed_main:
When you come out watching a movie, and proceed immediately to ticket window and book your tickets for next show, DILWALE is of that kind, in league of its own.

Rohit Shetty's funda is simple: Entertain the spectator with larger-than-life heroism, amusing episodes, high-pitched drama, clap-trap and fiery dialogue, foot-tapping music, gravity-defying action, mass appealing humor and of course, blow up as many cars as possible in trademark Rohit Shetty style, DILWALE has all of that and much, much more but this time he went ahead a step in entertaining us.

The best part of Dilwale is that role of every actor is very well sorted and everyone has equal importance.

Dilwale works, primarily thanks to the entertainment quotient and of course, the persuasive portrayals by its lead actors, especially SRK and Kajol. SRK is super-efficient and brings back the charm on screen. he has done some really cool stuff. At the same time,SRK allows VARUN to take the lead and he has does complete justice to those parts . Kriti looks gorgeous and did very well,even there 12-13 actors she made her presence felt. VARUN-KRITI look adorable together, would love to see them together in near future. unexpectedly, comic timing of Varun Sharma and Sanjay are unimpeachable.

KAJOL truly stands out, with SRK she just look perfect. after so long we get to see her on screen,that was so refreshing.she has done perfect justice to it. I think no one could have pulled off MEERA as she did. BOTH SRK -KAJOL has many shades and both were just perfect.

Perfect combination of drama, love & action in Dilwale style. The best Rohit Shetty movie. special mention to exotic locations and production design. content is very appealing, movie is very entertaining throughout and emotional towards ending.expect Hurricane at the BO, Sky is the limit.

FINAL WORD- brilliant, total Paisa Wasool, lets fall in love again.
As the leads were saying this junk is inception well this is not even close to worst movie ever made that bad this movie is

Seriously, this film only exists to please SRK-Kajol shippers. It's 100% banking on the nostalgia of older classic SRK-Kajol films to make a quick cash grab. And they managed to do it. The film is unnecessarily long, considering the plot is simple. You would have thought they have settle it sooner. The plot is borderline 80s - 90s Hindi films cliché. I thought the genre had died already 20 years past 2000. Apparently, it's still alive.

The action is full-package unapologetically over-the-top. But considering the stupid jokes and plotline, I actually welcomed it. The only real good thing it has got it going is its well-choreographed dance numbers and songs. But having said that, most Indian films has that quality. So that's not out of the ordinary.

A very bad film. If anyone even mentions this film besides Kuch Kuch Hota Hai is an insult to Kuch Kuch Hota Hai. 2 out of 5.

This is probably the best work of Rohit Shetty so far. I had gone to the cinema with very low expectations, but was really amazed to see such a brilliant story presented in a very beautiful way. The twists in the movie and the jokes were too good. I had only gone to see the SRK- Kajol pair, but the storyline of the movie just made my day special. It was good to see the supporting actors doing well too. You'll see Johnny Lever at his very best. The Varun-Kriti pair looked beautiful too. The response of the audience was amazing too. DILWALE is a complete family entertainer and is a sure shot blockbuster. I'm definitely going for it one more time.

Dilwale is a great joyride with plenty to watch out for. Superb music. Stunning action. Unbelievable landscapes. Energetic youth in the form of Varun-Kriti. And of course, the enigmatic SRK-Kajol! Each of these elements can make you want to watch the film by themselves. And when put together, Dilwale is the great entertaining result! The film ends on a high note with Tukur Tukur, a song that you will keep singing to yourself long after the film is done. Watch it, as by Rohit Shetty's standards, it's his most complete and entertaining film! The comedy element in the film is its strength. With top notch performances from the likes of Varun Sharma, Boman Irani, Sanjay Mishra and Johnny Lever, you will definitely laugh out loud every time they are on screen. The direction by Shetty is awesome, to put it simply. His vision and the scale of the film is insurmountable by any other entertainer in this genre. There are no compromises on budgets and it reflects on the film.

review_title: Dilwale Review - Movie to watch with family

review_title: A movie with great Comedy, go watch it with your Family!
review_detailed_main: Dilwale is honestly very good, it is really really funny and no joke it is the best that rohit shetty has made. The movie it self I give it a 8/10 but the comedy especially by Johnny Liver just killed me. I don't know what the hate comments are about but no joke you guys should go watch it with your family I guarantee the you'll in joy it! Shah rukh khan looks as dashing as ever and also Kajol omg is so damn hot! Varun Dhawan on the other hand made a funny an enjoying character also! review_title: Blockbuster, Amazing. Watch SRK and Kajol at their Best.
review_detailed_main:
At first i thought this would be a normal Romcom Action movie. The Trailer was okay, Music was great and it has the appeal to attract youths but due to Rohit Shetty's directorial venture one could think of a Movie with Average plot. But i was shocked after watching Dilwale, the Story is good (not boring), screenplay is amazing and the actress did a fairly good job. The real surprise is the plot twist which happened in the second half of the Movie. Can't tell really because for that you must go and watch it in theaters. Talking about the Acting, SRK is the real king of bollywood and he proved this once again. He was in a Bold and Serious avatar, grumpy sometimes but we did an amazing job. His counterpart Kajol was good too if not that great, one may miss the DDLJ spark in the Movie but this happens quite a long when you return in the Bollywood after a long time. Varun Dhawan was average, he tried to be witty and comic but failed. His dance moves in the Movie isn't that great, but his bromance with SRK was good and one can feel it. Overall average by Varun. Kriti shanon was the waste. He cant act or dance. She did quite well in her last Movie Heropanti but this was her worst performance. All the other comic actors very good and some great jokes very there in the first half. Overall a very entertaining movie. Action/Car stunts are like never seen before in Bollywood,some of the scene were copied from Movies like Mission Impossible. Other than the action scenes will give you the feel of Hollywood. Overall a complete entertainment package, Varun and Kriti shanon will put you down but the plot and the beautiful direction of Rohit Shetty will bring you the smile, pain, thriller and fun. SRK was great, his best role in last 5 years.

FINAL- MUST WATCH !!!

review_title: Anti-Srkians reviewed it wrong, Its the bingo package
review_detailed_main: I don't know why people saying it bad. well its not that high script movie, but it has adequate script to entertain people. and i think at that point, Dilwale is truly a complete package of entertainment. Love,Action,Comedy made it a complete entertaining movie. Though when i watched it, it was not only me, there were several people who're laughing at comics scene. and hooting was at peak.In short house was full with laughter. and also if you'll see the movie you'll get many messages, that brothers are always greater than your girlfriends, and many more. like your family comes first, then your love. I suggest you to watch it with your family because there is nothing wrong in movie. Watch it yourself instead of reading useless and insane reviews by insane and immature people.

I loved how it had such a good mix of comedy, drama, action & an intense romantic track. It has something for everyone, and is something the whole family can enjoy together. To have watched it in a packed theatre in Canada, with people laughing so hard at the comic scenes, clapping and whistling for the songs, dramatic twists & action, and just thoroughly having a good time throughout was incredible! Glad I got to watch it on the big screen. The songs look beautiful, and the action and stunts are meant for the big screen.

The whole ensemble cast is great, but the lead pair SRK & Kajol's magic is just outstanding. When you think they can't do any better than their previous films together, or that there's nothing new left to do, you see them in Dilwale & they just exceed your expectations again.

Kudos, Rohit Shetty! This is your best film yet.

review_title: Love has history and SRK & Kajol has chemistry.
review_detailed_main:
It's the kind of romantic drama that draws heavily on these two stars and their unrivalled on-screen chemistry. It's the kind of entertainer where the story is an afterthought. And that's a good thing.

The story goes thus: Meera and Raj belong to two warring Mafia families operating in Bulgaria. There's Raj, the adopted son of an India Mafia gang lord, brandishing guns and stealing trunks of gold from his opponents. He's a mean machine in a leather jacket, but turns soft after he runs into Meera. What follows is a squeaky clean courtship comprising dinner dates with flowers, ice-creams, candlelight dinner  the works. It's undoubtedly corny, but credit is due to Khan and Kajol for injecting it with believability. Just when you think that the movie is heading south, there's an interesting twists and ends with happy ending.

Movie has comic and love stories which will surely makes it a complete family drama and you can spare some time to watch it once.

review_title: A great film with everything for everyone
review_detailed_main: Dilwale is here, with the iconic romantic couple. Do not pay attention to the negative reviews here, by looking at the content and the way it is written it is clear that these people did not even watch this movie. This is a family masala entertainer, a great way to end 2015, a year which have been short of good films. The supporting cast did a great job & they are important for the story. Varun-kriti are cute as a couple, Varun sharma, J.lever & Sanjay Mishra are hilarious in their comedy role. Khanna & Bedi have small but very impactful roles. But the star of the film is without any doubt the evergreen couple, SRK- Kajol. After so many years it seems like nothing has changed between them. The way they look at each other make you think that they are actually real couple. (But don't go with the expectation of a new DDLJ, this is impossible) I wished there was more romance cause you just cant get enough of them. The action is not like other shetty films where people fly, its more Hollywood style. If you want to have a great time with friends, family or partner, just go for it and enjoy this amazingly sweet movie.

With awesome storyline this movie is just epic, its like the love story which doesn't gonna ends.

Starting with future scenes and in some time emotional past scenes give special impact to the story.

Music is brilliant, no any doubt about that. . . Acting of SRK, Varun and kriti was just at there best but kajol looks only good, because of Lefting to movie after comeback to 5 years. . . And the all the way This is just a classy looks of SRK and Kajol.

This movie is all about The special Jodi of SRK and kajol 😄

. I'm Damn Sure, if you are neutral, then sure, you will like this movie :-)

In my opinion,Dilwale is the movie full of action,comedy,romance,crime and lots of beautiful and attractive songs like Janam Janam and Gerua. The movie is hit because of the revival of Shahrukh and Kajol love story. Comedy is also very fantastic done by Varun Sharma and Johnny Lever. I also love this movie because of the talent of youngsters like Varun Dhawan/Sharma and Kriti Sanon. They were very outstanding. This movie contains lots of entertainment. You should watch this multi- talented movie created by ROHIT SHETTY and music is lovely. So please, please, please watch this movie.The story is also very beautiful and attractive.I am sure, you will like (Y) this movie. Just for entertainment.

review_title: A must-watch movie for Bollywood fans!
Too many Comedy for Romance Movie

But, I think, too many comedy in that movie, that's why, sometimes the best part of this movie just feel 'untouchy', doesn't seems every single Bollywood movie I've ever watched. review_title: It has Blockbuster written all over it! A complete Family Entertainer.
review_detailed_main:
Dilwale is an out and out family entertainer filled with Action, Comedy, Drama and Romance. It is not a content driven movie so obviously it is not high on content but it is indeed high on wholesome entertainment.

It's a Laugh Riot! Johnny Lever, Varun Dhawan,Varun Sharma and Sanjay Mishra all of them did a commendable job. Their Comic Timing was impeccable. Especially Sanjay Mishra's Clap worthy Dialogues and Johnny Lever's Hilarious Comic Scenes. Audience were clapping and laughing out loud in almost every comedy scenes.

Well.. what can i say about SRK and Kajol most iconic on screen couple.Their chemistry will surely mesmerize you. They have recreated their on screen magic again It is one of the highlights of the movie. SRK did a great job as innocent "Raj" and a Charming,Bad Ass "Kaali".Awesome performance by the King. Kajol proved it that she is still one of the best in the B-TOWN currently. Outstanding performance. She nailed it! Dilwale is a fun joyride with some twists and turns. All Thanks to Rohit Shetty.

It's a Must Watch Movie for SRK-Kajol fans and for some wholesome entertainment.

Go for Dilwale this Christmas. Dilwale will surely bring a smile on your face.

Watched Dilwale first day first show-First of all I would like to congratulate Rohit shetty for outdoing Himself in Dilwale. His best direction till date. First Half of Dilwale has a nice pace with rib tickling comedy sequences. Shahrukh's Entry scene with Johnny lever is outstanding. The story line took pace just before interval with lots of twist n turns.Second half is equally good.Acting of Shahrukh, kajol, Varun & Kriti is mind blowing. Last 20 mins of the film is designed for Hard-core family audience and they are going to love it. Varun Sharma, Sanjay Mishra, Mukesh Tiwari, Pankaj Tripathi and last but not least Johnny Lever did an awesome job. Overall Dilwale is thrice better than Chennai Express. Good family drama with loads of comedy action & drama. Must Watch. ATBB

review_title: Why so much negativity ? Its a fun film and its designed in that way only...
review_detailed_main: For the first time, I am actually feeling the negativity for SRK as this time he has made an actually nice film which is being wrongly scrutinised by the haters of SRK (Previously for Ra.One and HNY he was slammed badly, but those were disgusting films). This is a genuinely good film and please don't listen to all the negativity around. Most of it is influenced by the idiotic politicians, Bajirao Mastani fans and SRK haters. The film is designed to be a mass entertainer and it succeeds in that. It's true that u can't see the film the way you see other intellectual films. It's a mass film, a light film and does not deserve the biased reviews it's getting now. The music of the film is excellent, Performance of the lead actors is great, though Sanjay Mishra and Boman Irani disappointed. Editing is crisp. Background score completely compliments the narrative. Rohit Shetty succeeds in providing what he alway does- Full on Entertainment. If you don't apply much of your brain and watch it with a light heart, you will surely laugh a lot and love this film. Go Watch it with your family and have Fun....

review_title: A beautiful story that is undeveloped...
review_detailed_main:
I don't know why people expected this movie to be like DDLJ or any or Srk's past works. Did you guys watch the trailer before you saw it? The trailer didn't suggest that this would be the next DDLJ or etc. No one did. So why do people assume it's going to be a very serious movie? People will bash the film because they don't do their research or they have some sort of bias against it

This is a Rohit Shetty film, I repeat a Rohit Shetty film. And he has outdone himself to actually create a story. The comedy and cars do not prevail in this movie, Stk and Kajol do. The concept behind this movie is beautiful. Srk's acting is excellent and so is Kajol's. Her character actually really fits her personality. The film has all elements (comedy, romance, etc..). Beautifully filmed. The storyline is beautiful but not developed right.

I wish this film ran longer, because the scenes followed each other rapidly with no breathing time.. I wish they had really emphasized parts of the story or practically every scene. There seemed to be too much but too little time to fit it in, thus leaving you feel incomplete. Srk's acting is wonderful but an emphasized storyline would have done it justice. Seriously, the intensity of his character will blow you away. Maybe because this movie has all elements, it feels very rapid. Trying to fit too much in and leaving it feeling incomplete. You won't get a closure feeling from this because it will keep reminding you of Raj or Kaali. More songs would have been nice too!

I will be honest and say that it made me really nostalgic to see Kajol and SRK again, but the chemistry was coming more from SRK this time, not Kajol. His character really makes this movie. Overall a beautiful story but not fully developed. SRK does make this movie, and this movie will leave you incomplete. You will be wanting to go watch his old movies after this one. It left me feeling very sad, his character made me very sad.

I enjoyed watching dilwale. Its nice clean family entertainment and totally paisa vasool movie . I don't get the negative hype being spread about this movie , its not that bad at all . Yes there are few loopholes which could have been avoided but so is the case with every other movie . Performance wise everyone has done their part well and i think it could have done with less actors as there are too many good actors trying to do things which didn't really add too much to the movie. My whole family enjoyed it totally as there was something for everyone . I don't know what people were expecting out of a Rohit shetty movie so that they are left disappointed ? But for me it was a paisa vasool feel good entertainment with a good mix of comedy, drama, action and romance . Go and watch it and then decide .

Seriously, there is a lot of hate for this movie, I just don't get why. This film was thrilling, amazing, action-packed, jaw-dropping, you could even say a masterpiece. The way how it was created with all the mesmerising plot twists was incredible, the comedy was extremely humorous! Usually, comedy in films (Especially Bollywood films) is pretty terrible, however in this film I laughed a few times and found some of the characters and scenes very humorous. I feel like the reason why it got so much hate was how unique it was and 'western'. Many viewers that watched this film probably expected your usual happy and colourful Bollywood film.

This film didn't have many cons at all, apart from at some parts it was fairly easy to tell that animation was being used, however the animation was impressive.

Overall, I really enjoyed this film with all the action, plot-twists, romance, comedy, it was all great. I definitely recommend this film and I just love how unique it is.

Dilwale movie has been showered with praises from people who are watching the first day first show! While some are just simply going gaga over this Shahrukh Khan starrer flick directed by Rohit Shetty, there are quite a few people who feel Dilwale is not up-to expectations. Dilwale is a light-hearted entertaining film that has action, romance and comedy! The film features Shahrukh Khan, Kajol, Varun Dhawan, Kriti Sanon in lead roles while actors Boman Irani, Varun Sharma, Kabir Bedi, Vinod Khanna, Sanjay Mishra, Mukesh Tiwari, Johny Lever and Murli Sharma are seen playing pivotal roles!

From the looks of Shahrukh Khan-Kajol's sizzling chemistry from the movie, it is quite clear that Dilwale not only has the typical romance, action and comedy but it has also has an intense, eternal love story that takes place between Raj (Shahrukh Khan) and Meera (Kajol). The movie has released in foreign countries and the audiences who have viewed the film feel that Dilwale has a predictable story but Rohit manages to keep them hooked with surprising elements. As predicted, Shahrukh Khan and Kajol's intense chemistry is said to be the unique selling point of the movie! Rohits direction, Pritams music, Dudley's cinematography and death defying action stunts have all been super praised by the viewers. The comedy scenes make you laugh and the picturesque locations are a visual treat to your eyes. All in all, Dilwale has some really great aspects as expected and will give Bajirao Mastani a tough fight at the Box Office.

It was such a good movie. We laughed so hard watching this movie. It had been a long time we did not laugh so hard watching a movie. I think most of us have laughed so hard we can't breathe at some point in our lives. Im pretty sure everyone's having a good time watching this movie. Kajol is so pretty in the movie and shah rukh khan is still handsome as ever. The funniest Bollywood movie I had seen in a long time. *thumbs up*

Might just go and watch for the second time :P

Worth every penny.

Happy watching!

Cant wait to get the DVD so that i can watch over and over again.

review_title: Nice but not great, but for many people BAD
review_detailed_main: I think that this movie was pretty good, except not very good for adults. I mean as a kid I liked it, but my parents; not so much. There were a few scenes when Shahrukh Khan over acted. I think that this movie could have been a lot lot lot better if they put more action and a better story. This movie isn't worth any more than 7$ per person. If more, then it's not worth watching. As I mentioned, parents (adults not seniors) wouldn't like this movie (because my parents and the parents that came with us HATED this movie). Seniors would want a refund and extra money for wasting their time :). Remember people, if you are going to watch this movie, please watch it with less expectations.

For me it was an exceptional movie, best who have made both actors: Shah Ruk Khan and Kajol.

No doubt both are good actors have great chemistry and it shows in their expressions that friendship has surpassed the years is reflected.

The film has everything: it is funny, it is action, has romance, has dancing is cultural, this beautifully decorated, is fresh and is stylized. Magnificent landscapes, cars and places. Moments of romance and pain make hold your breath.

The libretto I also like, why? Because they are two stories that are woven into a past that wants to forget and hard returns, which only the power of love can conquer. For India, only love is the answer and this is reflected again and again at the insistence of the characters to achieve overcome the painful prejudices that separate them. With regard to the action, is sufficient to indicate that there are situations that are not expected, not seen get and of course mark the turning point ... and with respect to comedy, if someone does not like, is because it ignores that as humans we live the same situations anywhere in the world ... is funny feel human in any culture and know that other people have your same problems, concerns, peculiarities and comic moments.

Music . I can only say that I am as romantic, it was heaven. Song lyrics, locations, costumes and the performances of the actors was excellent. The music of this film is something that will not forget.

Like most Indian films, culture is strongly positioned and of course is oriented to the core values that you want to emphasize: love, loyalty, trust, humility and compassion. That is precisely what we value in Indian films and that unlike the rest of the world. India shows the world including pain love and hope ... ..nos invited to feel, to believe and to dream.

Come more films like Dilwale .... !!!!

This movie is a family entertainer. My dad always falls asleep when a Bollywood movie starts, but for once he was interested in a movie.

Everyone is saying the acting was bad, well you go and act. I bet you can't even stand there for a second. So instead of throwing hate u need to understand how much these actors and actresses worked.

The music was awesome. I really liked the comedy scenes. This movie is awesome! It's on Netflix so go watch it! Trust me, these reviews are written because they don't like the cast, they don't care about the story. Please watch it!

-BollywoodFan from the Netherlands🇳🇱

We didn't catch Dilwale in movie theaters and were looking forward for it to come out on iTunes. We purchased it as soon as it became available and so glad we did. It's a happy, light hearted movie for adults and kids. My whole family (adults and two teens) loved this movie very much. It has beautiful music, romantic love stories, nice cars and a lot of funny moments. Plus it reminds us of family values and respect to elders which never gets outdated. Overall happily spent two and and half hours for the whole family. It is worth purchasing because we definitely want to watch it again. I wish we could understand Hindi for a better viewing experience and not being glued to English subtitles. In our stressful and hectic lives it's a pleasure to relax a bit with a good movie like Dilwale. Shahrukh Khan is definitely the best actor in the world. We are new to Bollywood and SRK movies and keep enjoying them more and more.

review_title: Nostalgic to watch Kajol and Shah Rukh Khan!
review_detailed_main: This movie brings back so many childhood memories of watching Kajol and Shah Rukh Khan together! Absolutely loved this movie! Full fledged massy entertainer!

review_title: Despite everyones complaints, I loved it.
review_detailed_main: Honestly a lot of people are saying the 10 stars are fake, but I assure you my rating is not fake. To be entirely honest I watched the movie back when it came out, and loved it then and I love it now. I even re-watched it, which is a lot considering I NEVER re-watch shows unless it's that good. The reviews are saying it's cliche and I admit to a certain extent yes, but the videography. music and story line makes up for it. Yes it's a cliche, kind of like a Romeo and Juliet but they end up together in the end, however I don't see this cliche being done well often, and a lot of romances are based off of the cliche as subtle as it can be it's there. So that's nothing new, honestly I loved the idea and direction the story took, the actors acted many scenes wonderfully, I admit a few scenes were wonky but it was 2015 lmao. I love this movie full heartedly, and I don't like many indian movies. Maybe it's because I watch more english movies? No I watch more shows then movies and even that isn't entirely true.. I'm a Otaku so, I watch a lot of anime or at least used to, now I read Manga, and a lot of webcomics. I watch a lot of Kdrama, maybe that's why? Nevertheless my opinion stays the same even if you ask me years from now. Wish it got a sequal!

My first movie in cinema hall. Worth too watch. Was in Kota first day last show with housefull and so many fans was there to watch this movie. Was excited as first time watching movie on big screen. And its was surreal experience for me and happy that I choose this movie for first time experience. Sharukh khan acted well in the movie but too much comedy spoiled the movie. This movie is only to watch in theatre otherwise you will get bored. All characters acted well in the movie and we all cheered and clapped for all the stars specially dhawan was fantastic and romance between kajol and Khan was also special.

review_title: the movie disappoints at times but SRK steps forward to rescue it every time
review_detailed_main: the movie is a typical rohit Shetty movie with loads of action and cars flying around but what's disappointing is that every time rohit tried to groove out of his comfort zone..just like trying to get on the back of SRK-KAJOL romance he fails every time miserably. the only thing that keeps everyone still at their seats is tha way SRK handles the situation, especially in the second half he took the burden of whole movie on his shoulder solely.kriti and varun were good in their respective roles although at some scene varun's acting looked awkward but still he survived. comic timings of johnny lever and sanjay Mishra is great and varun sharma also has done a fine job. all and all one must watch this movie for entertainment and fun but without keeping high hopes.

Dilwale revolves around the story of Raj (Shah Rukh Khan) and Meera (Kajol), who are star-crossed lovers with a tumultuous past. The plot kicks off with Raj living under the alias Kaali, a car modifier and garage owner in Goa, with his younger brother Veer (Varun Dhawan). Veer falls in love with Ishita (Kriti Sanon), unknowingly connecting the two families again. As the story unfolds, the dark past between Raj and Meera is revealed, bringing old wounds to the forefront and testing the lovers' resilience.

The narrative is a blend of romance, action, and comedy, with a non-linear storytelling technique that reveals the backstory through flashbacks. The screenplay is fast-paced, trying to balance the multiple genres it touches. However, the script's attempt to juggle too many elements sometimes leads to a lack of depth in the storyline and character development.

review_title: One of the best movies since DDLJ
review_detailed_main: Hi I am a big Shahrukh fan and i loved the movie to bits. I literally cried when shahrukh and kajol find each other. Amazing movie 5 stars 10 stars 100stars. After watching the movie I went for a long walk in NewZealand and I've decided that shahrukh khan should be president of NZ. Shahrukh is the best i love all his movies

Facts - 20 December 2020 Google "The film went on to earn approximately $26.6 million (INR 1756.5 million) by February 2016. The film's final overseas gross was US$30.2 million (194 crore), the highest ever for a Shah Rukh Khan film, and making it the twelfth highest-grossing Indian film overseas."

It has probably grossed more than this since it is now 2022.

I have watched Dilwale countless times. I will not repeat summary; see other reviews. I am drawn by Love: the love of family and love between Kajol/Meera and Shah Rukh/Kaali. Raj. At another point in time Shah Rukh noted he and Kajol have the best 4 eyes in the film industry. So true in Dilwale. Should you re-watch, check out the eyes. Kajol's icy performance after the crash is stellar. Have only seen her in movies with SRK, so perhaps she has played such a hardened role in other films. But in Dilwale, this role was gripping. Shah Rukh stayed clearly in love the entire movie and portrayed the love, often with no words. His facial expressions convey a story. Additionally the scene between SRK and Varun Dhawan/Veer near the end of the movie when they expressed love as siblings was magnificent. Again Shah Rukh's eyes are an open book. And at the end of the scene, his eyes tell you he is angry and something important is going to happen.

I enjoyed the performances of Mukesh Tiwari and Pankaj Tripathi. Feel like their roles added pertinent information to the story.

Also liked action scenes. Thank you Rohit Shetty.

I rated the film an 8. Clearly higher than many other reviewers. Would love to have rated it 10. But I felt like it dragged in spots: Boman Irani scenes were too long; same for Johnny Lever; for sure with Sanjay Mishra. Also, the script for Dhawan was hokey, at times.

I bought the DVD set. This is a movie I will watch again and again.

My rating - 8.

Raj (Shah Rukh Khan) is devoted to his younger brother Veer (Varun Dhawan), but has kept family secrets from him. When Veer falls in love with Ishita (Kriti Sanon), Raj's past romance with Meera (Kajol) comes to light, affecting both couples.

This is an engaging masala film, with generally well-written comedy and drama, and nicely choreographed action sequences. As always, Khan and Kajol have near perfect chemistry, and their acting is excellent. Dhawan was natural and a good comedian, but Sanon was stiff and not fully convincing at times. The songs are mostly good, with one song memorably so, and the incidental music was particularly effective. The locations were beautiful, and the movie looked superb overall. Dilwale is thoroughly enjoyable, just barely missing ten stars, and one worth rewatching.

(Cast also includes Johnny Lever and Vinod Khanna.)
